title: Eucalyptus leaf
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf/ko "Eucalyptus leaf/ko")

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf/zh-CN "Eucalyptus leaf/zh-CN")

| % [![Eucalyptus leaf.png](/images/4/4e/Eucalyptus_leaf.png)](/wiki/File:Eucalyptus_leaf.png) |                                        |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                         | eucalyptus leaf                        |
| Base price                                                                                   | 6 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")        |
| Nutrition                                                                                    | [30](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")      |
| Turns to eat                                                                                 | 1                                      |
| Weight                                                                                       | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")             |
| Conduct                                                                                      | [vegan](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **eucalyptus leaf** is a type of [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Origin](#Origin)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Tourists may start with eucalyptus among their random food items.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Eucalyptus leaves are very rare and make up 3⁄1000 (0.3%) of all randomly-generated comestibles. General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), delicatessens and health food stores can sell eucalyptus leaves.

[Kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−[rnl](/wiki/Rnl "Rnl")(7)) eucalyptus leaves.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of 'fruit' that can be a eucalyptus leaf.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) If a tree is [tunneled](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of 'fruit' being left behind, which can be a eucalyptus leaves.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [charged](/wiki/Charged "Charged") [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 0.3% chance of generating a eucalyptus leaf or two.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a eucalyptus leaf confers 30 [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), and eating a non-cursed one will cure [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness") and [nausea](/wiki/Nausea "Nausea").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a eucalyptus leaf treats it as a whistle: it acts as a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") if blessed and a [tin whistle](/wiki/Tin_whistle "Tin whistle") otherwise, and there is a 1⁄50 chance of a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") eucalyptus leaf becoming uncursed after applying it.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The eucalyptus leaf now provides only 1 nutrition.

## Strategy

If you have a stack of eucalyptus but have not yet discovered a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle"), the eucalyptus can be a useful substitute if [dipped](/wiki/Dip "Dip") into [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water"). Eucalyptus leaves can also act as a reliable sickness cure for later stages of the game. (But bear in mind that there's still a small chance of the leaf being [rotten](/wiki/Rotten_food "Rotten food") and causing you to pass out for up to 10 turns.)

There is a 19.4% chance of getting eucalyptus leaves from any given tree by kicking it until it produces food, then cutting it down - the odds of finding any are much better if you encounter a [Big Room](/wiki/Big_Room "Big Room") map, [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") map, or [themed rooms](/wiki/Themed_room "Themed room") containing lots of trees. Specific role [Quests](/wiki/Quest "Quest") are also heavily populated by trees.

## History

The eucalyptus leaf first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Eucalyptus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eucalyptus "wikipedia:Eucalyptus")***

*Eucalyptus* is a genus of more than 700 species of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae, with most species being trees (often mallees) and a few of them being shrubs. They are commonly known as eucalypts or "gum trees", and have bark that is either smooth, fibrous, hard or stringy; the leaves have glands that produce oil, and the fruit is a woody capsule commonly referred to as a "gumnut". Most species of Eucalyptus are native to Australia, and every state and territory has representative species - about three-quarters of Australian forests are eucalypt forests, and many eucalypt species have adapted to wildfires. A few species are native to islands north of Australia and a smaller number are only found outside the continent.

The use of a eucalyptus leaf as a magic whistle is based on the Australian 1960s TV show *[Skippy the Bush Kangaroo](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skippy_the_Bush_Kangaroo "wikipedia:Skippy the Bush Kangaroo")*, which has a recognizable theme call played on a eucalyptus leaf that causes Skippy to come bounding through the bush to whoever played it.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L144)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1115](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dokick.c#L1115)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 398](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L398)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L1321)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L2219): *any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible*
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2246](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L2246)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/apply.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3569](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/apply.c#L3569)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Eucalyptus leaf

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name eucalyptus leaf
Base price 6 zm
Nutrition 30
Turns to eat 1
Weight 1
Conduct vegan

A eucalyptus leaf is a type of veggy comestible that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 References

Generation

Tourists may start with eucalyptus among their random food items.[1]

Eucalyptus leaves are very rare and make up 3⁄1000 (0.3%) of all randomly-generated comestibles. General stores, delicatessens and health food stores can sell eucalyptus leaves.

Kicking a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−rnl(7)) eucalyptus leaves.[2] Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of 'fruit' that can be a eucalyptus leaf.[3] If a tree is tunneled through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of 'fruit' being left behind, which can be a eucalyptus leaves.[4]

Applying a charged horn of plenty has a 0.3% chance of generating a eucalyptus leaf or two.[5]

Description

Eating a eucalyptus leaf confers 30 nutrition, and eating a non-cursed one will cure sickness and nausea.[6]

Applying a eucalyptus leaf treats it as a whistle: it acts as a magic whistle if blessed and a tin whistle otherwise, and there is a 1⁄50 chance of a blessed eucalyptus leaf becoming uncursed after applying it.[7]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The eucalyptus leaf now provides only 1 nutrition.

Strategy

If you have a stack of eucalyptus but have not yet discovered a magic whistle, the eucalyptus can be a useful substitute if dipped into holy water. Eucalyptus leaves can also act as a reliable sickness cure for later stages of the game. (But bear in mind that there's still a small chance of the leaf being rotten and causing you to pass out for up to 10 turns.)

There is a 19.4% chance of getting eucalyptus leaves from any given tree by kicking it until it produces food, then cutting it down - the odds of finding any are much better if you encounter a Big Room map, Medusa's Island map, or themed rooms containing lots of trees. Specific role Quests are also heavily populated by trees.

History

The eucalyptus leaf first appears in NetHack 3.3.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Eucalyptus

Eucalyptus is a genus of more than 700 species of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae, with most species being trees (often mallees) and a few of them being shrubs. They are commonly known as eucalypts or "gum trees", and have bark that is either smooth, fibrous, hard or stringy; the leaves have glands that produce oil, and the fruit is a woody capsule commonly referred to as a "gumnut". Most species of Eucalyptus are native to Australia, and every state and territory has representative species - about three-quarters of Australian forests are eucalypt forests, and many eucalypt species have adapted to wildfires. A few species are native to islands north of Australia and a smaller number are only found outside the continent.

The use of a eucalyptus leaf as a magic whistle is based on the Australian 1960s TV show Skippy the Bush Kangaroo, which has a recognizable theme call played on a eucalyptus leaf that causes Skippy to come bounding through the bush to whoever played it.
